verses.verse: Abram <S%H87><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> out of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> he, <S%H802><s%> his wife, all that he had, <S%H3876><s%> and Lot with him, <S%H5045><s%> into the South.
Abram <S%H87><s%> was very <S%H3966><s%> rich <S%H3513><s%> in livestock, <S%H4735><s%> in silver, <S%H3701><s%> and in gold. <S%H2091><s%>

He went <S%H3212><s%> on his journeys <S%H4550><s%> from the South <S%H5045><s%> even to Bethel, <S%H1008><s%> to the place <S%H4725><s%> where his tent <S%H168><s%> had been <S%H1961><s%> at the beginning, <S%H8462><s%> between Bethel <S%H1008><s%> and Ai, <S%H5857><s%>

to the place <S%H4725><s%> of the altar, <S%H4196><s%> which he had made <S%H6213><s%> there at the first. <S%H7223><s%> There Abram <S%H87><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> on the name <S%H8034><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>
Lot <S%H3876><s%> also, <S%H1980><s%> who went with <S%H854><s%> Abram, <S%H87><s%> had flocks, <S%H6629><s%> and herds, <S%H1241><s%> and tents. <S%H168><s%>

The land <S%H776><s%> was not able to bear <S%H5375><s%> them, <S%H3427><s%> that they might live together: <S%H3162><s%> for their substance <S%H7399><s%> was great, <S%H7227><s%> so that they could <S%H3201><s%> not live <S%H3427><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>

There was a strife <S%H7379><s%> between the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Abram <S%H87><s%>'s livestock <S%H4735><s%> and the herdsmen <S%H7462><s%> of Lot <S%H3876><s%>'s livestock: <S%H4735><s%> and the Canaanite <S%H3669><s%> and the Perizzite <S%H6522><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the land at that time. <S%H776><s%>

Abram <S%H87><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Lot, <S%H3876><s%> "Please, <S%H1961><s%> let there be no <S%H408><s%> strife <S%H4808><s%> between me and you, <S%H7462><s%> and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen; <S%H7462><s%> for we <S%H582><s%> are relatives. <S%H251><s%>

Isn't <S%H776><s%> the whole land before you? <S%H6440><s%> Please separate yourself <S%H6504><s%> from me. <S%H8040><s%> If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right. <S%H3231><s%> Or if you go to the right hand, <S%H3225><s%> then I will go to the left. <S%H8041><s%>"

Lot <S%H3876><s%> lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> all the plain <S%H3603><s%> of the Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> that it was well-watered <S%H4945><s%> everywhere, <S%H6440><s%> before Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> destroyed <S%H7843><s%> Sodom <S%H5467><s%> and Gomorrah, <S%H6017><s%> like the garden <S%H1588><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> like the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> as you go <S%H935><s%> to Zoar. <S%H6820><s%>

So Lot <S%H3876><s%> chose <S%H977><s%> the Plain <S%H3603><s%> of the Jordan <S%H3383><s%> for himself. <S%H3876><s%> Lot traveled <S%H5265><s%> east, <S%H6924><s%> and they separated themselves <S%H6504><s%> the one <S%H376><s%> from the other. <S%H251><s%>

Abram <S%H87><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan, <S%H3667><s%> and Lot <S%H3876><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> in the cities <S%H5892><s%> of the plain, <S%H3603><s%> and moved his tent <S%H167><s%> as far <S%H5704><s%> as Sodom. <S%H5467><s%>
Now the men <S%H582><s%> of Sodom <S%H5467><s%> were exceedingly <S%H3966><s%> wicked <S%H7451><s%> and sinners <S%H2400><s%> against Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Abram, <S%H87><s%> after <S%H310><s%> Lot <S%H3876><s%> was separated <S%H6504><s%> from him, <S%H5375><s%> "Now, lift up your eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and look <S%H7200><s%> from the place <S%H4725><s%> where you are, <S%H6828><s%> northward and southward <S%H5045><s%> and eastward <S%H6924><s%> and westward, <S%H3220><s%>
for all the land <S%H776><s%> which you see, <S%H7200><s%> I will give <S%H5414><s%> to you, <S%H5704><s%> and to your offspring <S%H2233><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>

I will make <S%H7760><s%> your offspring <S%H2233><s%> as the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> so that <S%H834><s%> if a man <S%H376><s%> can <S%H3201><s%> number <S%H4487><s%> the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> then your seed <S%H2233><s%> may also be numbered. <S%H4487><s%>
Arise, <S%H6965><s%> walk <S%H1980><s%> through the land <S%H776><s%> in its length <S%H753><s%> and in its breadth; <S%H7341><s%> for I will give it to you. <S%H5414><s%>"

Abram <S%H87><s%> moved his tent, <S%H167><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> and lived <S%H3427><s%> by the oaks <S%H436><s%> of Mamre, <S%H4471><s%> which are in Hebron, <S%H2275><s%> and built <S%H1129><s%> an altar <S%H4196><s%> there to Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>
